TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit Vector4 extends System.ValueType implements class System.IEquatable`1<valuetype System.Numerics.Vector4>, class System.IFormattable

Docs.summary: Represents a vector with four single-precision floating-point values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Vector4 structure provides support for hardware acceleration.

.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(float32[] array) cil managed

Docs.summary: Copies the elements of the vector to a specified array.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `array` must have at least four elements. The method copies the vector's elements starting at index 0.

Docs.exception: The number of elements in the current instance is greater than in the array.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (float[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(float32[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The index at which to copy the first element of the vector.
Docs.summary: Copies the elements of the vector to a specified array starting at a specified index position.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `array` must have a sufficient number of elements to accommodate the four vector elements. In other words, elements `index` through `index` + 3 must already exist in `array`.

Docs.exception: The number of elements in the current instance is greater than in the array.

is less than zero.
-or-
is greater than or equal to the array length.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string ToString ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the string representation of the current instance using default formatting.
Docs.returns: The string representation of the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns a string in which each element of the vector is formatted using the "G" (general) format string and the formatting conventions of the current thread culture. The "\<" and ">" characters are used to begin and end the string, and the current culture's <xref:System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.NumberGroupSeparator%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property followed by a space is used to separate each element.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ToString (string format);
.method public hidebysig instance string ToString(string format) cil managed

Docs.param: A [standard](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) or [custom numeric format string](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) that defines the format of individual elements.
Docs.summary: Returns the string representation of the current instance using the specified format string to format individual elements.
Docs.returns: The string representation of the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns a string in which each element of the vector is formatted using `format` and the current culture's formatting conventions. The "\<" and ">" characters are used to begin and end the string, and the current culture's <xref:System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.NumberGroupSeparator%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property followed by a space is used to separate each element.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ToString (string format, IFormatProvider formatProvider);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string ToString(string format, class System.IFormatProvider formatProvider) cil managed

Docs.param: A [standard](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) or [custom numeric format string](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) that defines the format of individual elements.
A format provider that supplies culture-specific formatting information.
Docs.summary: Returns the string representation of the current instance using the specified format string to format individual elements and the specified format provider to define culture-specific formatting.
Docs.returns: The string representation of the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns a string in which each element of the vector is formatted using `format` and `formatProvider`. The "\<" and ">" characters are used to begin and end the string, and the format provider's <xref:System.Globalization.NumberFormatInfo.NumberGroupSeparator%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property followed by a space is used to separate each element.
